11/21/2024 5:10 PM
70-DR-2023-900051.01
CIRCUIT COURT OF
TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
PATRICK CRADDOCK, CLERK
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
CHRISTOPHER BLAINE MCGREGOR,
Respondent,
v.
CASE NO.: 70-DR-2023-900051.01
BRITTANY MICHELLE GILLILAND,
Petitioner.
RENEWED MOTION FOR PENDENTE LITE RELIEF
COMES NOW, Petitioner-Mother BRITTANY GILLILAND, by and through the
undersigned counsel of record, Barbara H. Agricola, with the law firm of Agricola Law, LLC, and
hereby files a Renewed Motion for Pendente Lite Relief. In support thereof, Mother states as
follows:
1. Parties appeared before this Honorable Court for a Show Cause Hearing on July 31,
2024 and announced an agreement on record regarding the terms for reunification
therapy for the Minor Child A.K. and Mother, co-parenting, family dinners, and joint
counselling sessions;
2. This Honorable Court issued an order on November 6, 2024 [Doc. 66] which ordered
the Parties to initiate reunification therapy with Minor Child A.K., effective
immediately;
3. Paragraph four of this Court’s Order states, in part, “If Father ever impedes upon these
counselling sessions, causes A.K. to miss the sessions, or allows A.K. to miss these
sessions, for any reason other than emergency, this will be considered willful contempt
of this Court’s order”;
Brittany Michelle Gilliland v. Christopher Blaine McGregor
Circuit Court of Tallapoosa County, Alabama
Case No.: CL-2024-0597
Renewed Motion for PDL Relief
Page 1 of 4
DOCUMENT 84
4. Mother scheduled her first appointment with Kelly Turner, a reunification therapist,
and informed Father of the date. After scheduling this appointment, Father proceeded
to schedule an appointment for A.K. to be evaluated for possible ADHD on the date of
the reunification therapy. Then, Father contacted Kelly Turner and informed her that
the appointment would need to be rescheduled due to this appointment. See Exhibit A,
Father’s messages in a group text with Mother and Kelly Turner. Father also personally
texted Mother incorrectly claiming that he had scheduled his appointment for A.K. first,
despite this not being the case. Further, per the Court’s order, reunification therapy
takes precedence over any prior commitment due to the circumstances regarding this
present action, specifically Father’s severe parental alienation of A.K.;
5. Further, this Order also establishes weekly family dinners between the Parties and
Minor Children. The Parties engaged in their first weekly dinner, in which Father was
purposefully antagonizing and berating Mother and stating, in front of Minor Children
including A.K., that Mother was “forcing” A.K. to attend the dinner and disrupting
A.K.’s schedule. Father began raising his voice and A.K. became distressed and began
to berate Mother as well, stating that Mother was the reason A.K. was performing
poorly in school. The undersigned has recordings of this dinner for the Court’s review.
Father complied with the court-ordered dinner, though it is clear he is trying to further
harm Mother’s relationship with A.K. Father’s behavior was so horrendous that after
he left with the Children, several workers employed at the restaurant approached
Mother to console her after witnessing the ordeal. Mother filed a police report to
document this incident. See Exhibit B, the incident report;
Brittany Michelle Gilliland v. Christopher Blaine McGregor
Circuit Court of Tallapoosa County, Alabama
Case No.: CL-2024-0597
Renewed Motion for PDL Relief
Page 2 of 4
DOCUMENT 84
6. Father continues to consistently interfere with Mother’s ability to follow this Court’s
Order and alienate Mother from A.K., despite every good-faith attempt Mother has
taken that showcases her willingness to rekindle her relationship with A.K.;
7. Further, Father has contacted DHR and notified Mother’s employer that her wages will
be garnished due to not paying child support. However, Father has filed for bankruptcy
in an effort to avoid his required $2,000.00 a month equity payment to Mother, which
has greatly reduced her income making her unable to pay child support. Thus child
support is due to be paused until Father resumes his $2,000.00 equity payments to
Mother;
8. Father is in willful contempt of this Court’s Order and Mother has incurred attorney’s
fees due to Father’s continued contempt and forced to take the present action.
WHEREFORE, PREMISES CONSIDERED, Mother respectfully requests that the
Court GRANT the following relief:
1. GRANT Mother’s motion for pendente lite relief.
2. Find Father in contempt of this Honorable Court’s Order.
3. Impose appropriate sanctions to Father to compel compliance with the Order.
4. Temporarily pause child support.
5. ORDER that Father pay Mother’s attorney’s fees as a result of Father’s contempt.
6. GRANT to Mother such other and further relief as the Court deems just, proper,
and to which in equity and good conscience she may be entitled.
9. Respectfully submitted on November 21, 2024.
/s/ Barbara H. Agricola (AGR004)
Attorney for Mother
Brittany Michelle Gilliland v. Christopher Blaine McGregor
Circuit Court of Tallapoosa County, Alabama
Case No.: CL-2024-0597
Renewed Motion for PDL Relief
Page 3 of 4
